title: Config
text: Menu Options > Config  Spada yout can choose configurations persist trough RDS files saved R_user_dir folder. One file Session Data another file Config. options available : Plot colors Line: color line Fill: fill color plots Themes Spada: default theme Dark Spada: based Boosttrap Darkly Size inputed files choose size files imported (default 1 GB) Session Restore data startup: Always Never (default) Save exit: Always Ask (default) Never

title: Data
text: Spada capable manage several datasets. Active Dataset shown sidebar navbar.can change active dataset, import new datasets export datasets.

title: Data
text: tab shows descriptive data Acctive Dataset.

title: Data
text: Metadata one can see tyhe type class variables, well informatios data: min max values, unique, valid, zeros missing data. possible choose datasets among imported ones show ta metadata. change Active Dataset.

title: Data
text: Overview allows user see sample Data. possible choose number rows show, well position data (first, last random sample rows).

title: Data
text: tab one can change : Rename dataset Change Active Dataset Copy dataset Delete dataset Spada requires least one active dataset, tpossible delete Active one.

title: Data
text: possible import datasets outside Spada package. formats available : csv: imported via data.table package RDS: R native format sav: SPSS format imported via haven package

title: Data
text: also possible save atsets file. formats available : csv: exported via data.table package RDS: R native format sav: SPSS format exported via haven package

title: Docker
text: best way run Spada Docker. Spada uses specific versions packages R , Container ensures everything need run Spada properly.

title: Docker
text: Docker Desktop click Docker Hub.  Search spada.

title: Docker
text: Find tag want download click Pull image. download image Docker Hub.  download completed image appear Images.  Click desired image.

title: Docker
text: Click Run  Open Optional settings.  Insert Name Container set Host Port 3838.  Now Container running.  open , click 3838:3838 Container name go browser use localhost:3838 address.  web browser open localhost:3838.

title: Intro
text: basic object Spada dataset. dataset object data.frame class. Internally, speed programmability purposes, Spada uses data.table class data.table package. Spada demands least one dataset. none provided funcion call Iris Mtcars, datasets package, used sample data. multiples datasets input:

title: Intro
text: user desires give names datasets, Spada function called like : Spada make valid unique names make.names function. : result names: dataset.1, test.data dataset.1.1. user inform least one name, Spada assume datasets receive name (instead name original object) create valid unique names using dataset_n, n sequencial number: result names: dataset.1, dataset_2 dataset_3.
code: spada('dataset' = iris, 'test_data' = mtcars) spada('dataset 1' = iris, 'test data' = mtcars, 'dataset 1' = cars) spada('dataset 1' = iris, mtcars, cars)

title: Intro
text: dataset operations applied Active dataset. One can think dataset current object. Spada requires least one dataset, won’t possible delete Active dataset.

title: Intro
text: Spada uses page_navbar bslib package. left side menus lead app pages. right side Active dataset name.

title: Intro
text: default selected item.

title: Themes
text: Spada 2 themes: Spada Dark Spada

title: Themes
text: Menu Options > Config  Open Theme  Choose desired Theme Apply. app updated choosed theme.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Luís Gustavo Schuck. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schuck L (2026). spada: Shiny Package Data Analysis. R package version 0.1.2, https://github.com/lgschuck/spada.
code: @Manual{,   title = {spada: Shiny Package for Data Analysis},   author = {Luís Gustavo Schuck},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://github.com/lgschuck/spada}, }

title: Shiny Package for Data Analysis
text: goal spada provide visual tools Data Analysis Shiny App. package inspired many tools like: IBM SPSS Statistics (https://www.ibm.com/products/spss-statistics) R Commander package (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Rcmdr/index.html) Jamovi (https://www.jamovi.org/) ydata profiling (https://docs.profiling.ydata.ai/latest/) Warning: Spada active development.

title: Shiny Package for Data Analysis
text: can access Spada Book website: Spada Book.

title: Shiny Package for Data Analysis
text: can install development version spada GitHub using command . way get packages used Spada development. specific release visit Releases change ref parameter bellow tag name:
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github(   "lgschuck/spada",   dependencies = TRUE,   repos = 'https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/2024-12-10'   ) remotes::install_github(   "lgschuck/spada",   dependencies = TRUE,   repos = 'https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/2024-12-10',   ref = "0.1.0"   )

title: Shiny Package for Data Analysis
text: Spada distributed Docker Image. instructions download use Spada go Articles > Docker can use Docker Hub search diferent versions.

what: First n value taking NA's into account — fina
title: First n value taking NA's into account — fina
text: values NA returns NA

title: First n value taking NA's into account — fina
First n value taking NA's into account — fina
text: x Object values n Position return, default 1 (first). zero less corrected 1 na_rm TRUE T remove NA's. Default value T.

title: First n value taking NA's into account — fina
code: fina(c(5, 1, 2, 3, NA)) #> [1] 5 fina(c(5, 1, 2, 3, NA), n = 2) #> [1] 1 fina(c(NA, 1, 2, 3, NA), na_rm = TRUE) #> [1] 1 fina(c(NA, 1, 2, 3, NA), na_rm = FALSE) #> [1] NA fina(c(NA, NA, NA), na_rm = TRUE) #> [1] NA fina(c(NA, NA, NA), na_rm = FALSE) #> [1] NA

title: Test if values are valid names — is_valid_name
code: 'abc ' |> is_valid_name() #> [1] FALSE 'abc' |> is_valid_name() #> [1] TRUE c(1, 'a', 'b') |> is_valid_name() #> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE list('1', 2, 3, NA, 'a') |> is_valid_name() #> [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE

text: values NA returns NA

Last n value taking NA's into account — lana
text: x Object values n Position return, default 1 (last). zero less corrected 1. na_rm TRUE T removes NA's. Default value T.

title: Last n value taking NA's into account — lana
code: lana(c(5, 1, 2, 3, NA)) #> [1] 3 lana(c(NA, 1, 2, 3, NA), na_rm = FALSE) #> [1] NA lana(c(5, 1, 2, 3, NA), n = 3) #> [1] 1 lana(c(5, 1, 2, 3, NA), n = 3) #> [1] 1 lana(c(NA, NA, NA), na_rm = TRUE) #> [1] NA lana(c(NA, NA, NA), na_rm = FALSE) #> [1] NA

title: Functions to calculate percentiles — pn
text: Functions calculate percentiles

title: Functions to calculate percentiles — pn
code: pn(y, p, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p10(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p25(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p75(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p90(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p95(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)  p99(y, na_rm = TRUE, ...)

title: Functions to calculate percentiles — pn
text: y Object values p Probs quantile function na_rm Removes NAs ... quantile function

title: Spada 0.2.0 - Future Version
text: 1 - Functionalities detect treat duplicates 2 - Functionalities detect treat outliers 3 - Inference: t test 4 - Models: logistic regression

title: Spada 0.1.2 (in development)
text: Update dependencies (2026-01-30), new Group Summarise modules, new startup exit screens (waiter package) better Metadata recalculation

title: Spada 0.1.2 (in development)
text: 1 - Filter Rows module: internal improvements, improved tests now ’s possible filter values another dataset variable (#59) 2 - New startup screen: new startup close screens (waiter now dependencie, shinybusy removed) 3 - SelectizeInputs: new width 80% better use screen 4 - Main sidebar: now opens default accordions (active dataset datasets) better size Preview datasets popover 5 - Config nrows plots: now value input multiplied 1e3 6 - Metadata calculation: avoids recalculation better performance visual feel 7 - IDate metadata table: now IDate class receives calenda icon (#58) 8 - Data backup: backup events Edit page now data_bkp module 9 - Metadata tests: better metadata tests spada_server 10 - Data module: manage dataset events (copy, delete, etc) now data module 11 - Calculate module: check allowed operations ins function apply 12 - Sidebar module: new input change active dataset dynamically (also included test testthat) changed renderUI textOutput better visuals 13 - Output save: now saves CSS style

title: Spada 0.1.2 (in development)
text: 1 - New Summarise module: distinct count functions choosed variable (overwrite create new dataset) 2 - New Group module: now ’s possible group data new (overwriting active) dataset

title: Spada 0.1.2 (in development)
text: 1 - Import File module: now apply make_valid_cols import file avoiding invalid names variables 2 - Sidebar preview dataset: now shows 5 NROW smaller 5 rows datasets

title: Spada 0.1.2 (in development)
text: 1 - New restore session modal 2 - Change icons 3 - Sharp corners buttons, inputs popovers 4 - Set font-family: Segoe UI 5 - Navbar color: lighter blue color ‘#0A5A88’ 6 - Small CSS changes

title: Spada 0.1.1

title: Spada 0.1.1
text: 1 - utils.R: improved/new functions (desc_stats, df_info, is_spada_df, load_conf, spada_plot, test_output_format) make_valid_cols now converts complex char 2 - qs2: now session data saved qs2 format better performance/compression 3 - Import export modules: new option qs2 format 4 - Output: output structure rewritten (better management future options edit/delete) new tab Output meta showing elements gt table 5 - Metadata: now metadata calculated data change, big improvement speed (#55) 6 - Sidebar Navbar modules: now render metadata (removed button) better visual user experience 7 - Config module: new title color plot limit (plot samples) options (#56) show current conf (#54) 8 - Visuals: new default fill color “#0099F8”
